publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3463 Donald Gorrie: Redundancy Insurance—That the Parliament, in light of the experience of the Citizens Advice Bureaux in giving advice to people that become unemployed, urges insurance companies to make much clearer the limit and extent of cover, in relation to credit and debt issues, given by their policies guarding people against redundancy and to highlight the limit and extent of such cover in the relevant proposal forms and related literature.Supported by: Robert Brown*, Nora Radcliffe*, George Lyon*, Tavish Scott*, Robin Harper*

S1M-3463 Donald Gorrie: Redundancy Insurance—That the Parliament, in light of the experience of the Citizens Advice Bureaux in giving advice to people that become unemployed, urges insurance companies to make much clearer the limit and extent of cover, in relation to credit and debt issues, given by their policies guarding people against redundancy and to highlight the limit and extent of such cover in the relevant proposal forms and related literature.Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, George Lyon, Tavish Scott, Robin Harper, Shona Robison*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Mr Murray Tosh*

S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Fergus Ewing*, David Mundell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Margaret Jamieson*, John Farquhar Munro*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr John McAllion*, Ian Jenkins*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Tommy Sheridan*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Susan Deacon*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3463 Redundancy Insurance (lodged on 3 October 2002) Pauline McNeill*
